author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Central government is ready to consider the names of persons already in the pipeline for the posts of judges in various High Courts, Union Law Minister D.V. Sadananda Gowda said here on Friday.

Pointing out that 115 persons were being considered for the post of HC judges, he said the government would not have any “ego problem” in considering them under the existing Memorandum of Procedure (MoP) as the draft of the new MoP is under preparation as per the direction of the apex court, which had struck down the National Judicial Appointments Commission (NJAC).

Mr. Gowda was addressing the members of Bengaluru Advocates’ Association after inaugurating the office of the Additional Solicitor-General of India at the Karnataka High Court premises in the city.

The new proposals for the posts of HC judges could be considered as per the new MoP, he said.
title: ‘Ready to consider names already in list for judges’ posts’
